Furthermore, although one may plant few wholesome roots, one must definitely seek the Buddha. Even a little wholesome root seeking the Buddha is like nectar, and therefore one should wholeheartedly seek the Buddha.

Venerable Gautama!
The Buddha, with a mind of loving-kindness free from aversion and attachment, spoke a verse, saying:

You should not be as usual, but should give rise to respect.
It is like using clay and wood to make a Buddha image,
When it has not yet been completed, stepping on it to cut and carve,
Once it is completed, one should respectfully make offerings with incense and flowers.
You should also get rid of the attitude of intimacy and friendship,
And should respect me, not giving rise to contempt.
Do not be delighted by praise, nor angry at slander,
I now have compassion for you, wishing for you to attain liberation,
Enabling you to attain the bliss of tranquility, and obtain all beneficial matters.
Ignorance, craving, and hatred each have their own characteristics,
Satirizing and speaking evil words is like sprinkling ashes on a wound.
I now abide in enlightenment, and they call me Gautama,
Although I am without love or hatred, one should give rise to an attitude of respect,
Do not speak such words again, Slandering and denigrating others.
At that time, although the five people heard these words, they still said in verse, thinking that the World-Honored One had not yet attained enlightenment:
You previously practiced austerities, yet did not attain enlightenment,
You are mired in the mud, how can you attain the Way?
It is like abandoning a great ship, and carrying a mountain of rocks,
How can one who wishes to cross the river's difficulties possibly succeed?

At that time, the World-Honored One knew that the five people's minds were attached to ascetic practices as the right path. The Buddha then explained for them that avoiding the five desires is the right path, and that avoiding ascetic practices is also the right path. Excluding the two extremes, he taught the middle way.
The Buddha, with compassion as the foremost, spoke a verse, saying:
Only wisdom can remove the obstructions of ignorance and foolishness,
Therefore, one must use wisdom to protect one's body and life.
Some with life attain wisdom, beds, bedding, and clothing,
Food and drink, and decoctions and medicine, by which they preserve their lives.
If there is no such thing as above, then the body and life will be destroyed,
By this, protecting the body and life, one firmly upholds the precepts.
By upholding the precepts, one attains concentration and wisdom, not by practicing austerities, one attains
Starving oneself and cutting off food is not necessarily the way to attain the Way.
When the body is destroyed, then life is ruined, when life is ruined, there is also no body,
Violating the precepts is without concentration and wisdom, without concentration, there is also no wisdom.
Therefore, one should protect life, and also uphold the precepts,
Because of upholding the precepts, one then attains concentration and wisdom.
Therefore, one should stay far away from the suffering and distress that destroy the Dharma body,
And also stay away from the five desires, one should not deeply delight in and become attached to them.
If one delights in and becomes attached to greed and desire, then one will violate the precepts,
And further extend their desire and love.
They enjoy fasting, or eating only leaves,
Lying on ashes or thorns, thus harming their bodies and lives,
But cannot attain concentration and wisdom.
Relying on such methods, do not sink in the mud of desire,
And also do not torment the body.
Such two faults, like the moon loved by all,
The middle way is also like this.
People mostly sink, ascetic practices scorch the body and mind,
And also do not avoid this trouble;
Abandoning these two extremes, the middle way reaches nirvana.

If one can attain the path by precepts, concentration, and wisdom,
It is like a person who holds the body, wishing to eliminate all faults and evils,

For this reason, one should not abandon clothing, food and drink, and bedding;
One should also not give rise to a mind of attachment to these things.

I once heard that there was a poor man who thought like this:
I should go to the temple to seek present-life benefits and wealth.
Having thought this, he said to his younger brother:
You should work hard on the farm and make a good living, do not let there be any shortage in the household.
He then took his younger brother to the fields, saying, Here you can plant sesame, here you can plant wheat, here you can plant rice and beans.

After showing him where to plant, he went to the temple to hold a great sacrificial ceremony for the disciples of the heavenly sacrifice, offering incense and flowers, anointing the ground with fragrant mud, and worshiping day and night, seeking blessings and hoping for increased wealth in the present world.
At that time, the heavenly deity had this thought:
Looking at that poor man, does he have any causes and conditions of the merit of giving in his past lives?
If there are slight causes and conditions, I should devise a means to bring him prosperity.
After observing that man, he found that he had no causes and conditions of giving at all, and had this thought again:
Since that man has no causes and conditions, but now diligently seeks me and makes requests, he is just working hard without benefit, and will resent me.
He then transformed into the younger brother and came to the temple. At that time, the elder brother said:
What have you planted?
Why have you come back?
The transformed younger brother said:
I also came to request the celestial spirit, to make the spirit rejoice and seek clothing and food.
Although I did not plant, by the power of the celestial spirit, the grains and wheat in the fields will naturally be sufficient.
The elder brother reprimanded his younger brother, saying:
How can there be a field where no seeds are planted and yet a harvest is hoped for?
This is impossible.
He then spoke a verse, saying:ğŸ”½Within the four seas and the great earth,
and in all places,ğŸ”½how can there be one who does not plant seeds
and yet obtains fruits?
At that time, the transformed younger brother questioned his elder brother, saying:
Is it the case in the world that one does not plant seeds and does not obtain fruits?
The elder brother replied to his younger brother, saying:
It is true, without planting there are no fruits.
Then the celestial spirit returned to his original form and spoke a verse, saying:
You now say yourself that without planting there is no fruit,
Without the cause of giving in a previous body, how can you now obtain the fruit?
Although you now suffer hardship, fasting to make offerings to me,
In vain you make yourself work hard, and also disturb and afflict me.
By what means can you make me have beneficial things now?
If you wish to obtain wealth, property, wife, children, and relatives,
You should purify your body and speech and engage in the practice of giving.
Without planting, obtaining blessings and benefits, the sun, moon, and stars,
Should not illuminate the world;
Because they illuminate the world, one should know it is due to the causes of karma.
Each also has distinctions, with much merit and great majestic virtue,
Little merit and few majestic virtues;
All are due to karma. Through giving, one obtains wealth and property.
By observing precepts, one is born in the heavens. If there is no cause of giving,
All majestic virtues are completely diminished, and concentration and wisdom attain liberation.
These three kinds of rewards are explained by the Ten Powers.
These kinds are all causes, and should not disturb me.
Therefore, one should cultivate practices in order to seek auspicious fruits.
Furthermore, the fruit obtained from seeds is not due to the power of auspiciousness. Therefore, one should not doubt or cling to auspicious signs.
